.method public hidebysig instance !T WithProofOfPossession(class Microsoft.Identity.Client.AppConfig.PoPAuthenticationConfiguration popAuthenticationConfiguration) cil managed
Public Function WithProofOfPossession (popAuthenticationConfiguration As PoPAuthenticationConfiguration) As T

Docs.param: Configuration properties used to construct a proof of possession request.
Docs.summary: Modifies the token acquisition request so that the acquired token is a Proof of Possession token (PoP), rather than a Bearer token. PoP tokens are similar to Bearer tokens, but are bound to the HTTP request and to a cryptographic key, which MSAL can manage on Windows. See https://aka.ms/msal-net-pop

list.item: An Authentication header is automatically added to the request
The PoP token is bound to the HTTP request, more specifically to the HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.) and to the Uri (path and query, but not query parameters).
MSAL creates, reads and stores a key in memory that will be cycled every 8 hours.
This is an experimental API. The method signature may change in the future without involving a major version upgrade.
